message:
Open source team chat, might be useful for anyone who wants to dabble in Elixir, Erlang's good looking friend. It uses Ember too for most of its client side.
Elixir smells like ruby but runs on the Erlang VM.

data.message: This looks like like an open source clone of Atlassian's HipChat https://www.hipchat.com/ - Very good :)

I used HipChat in a couple projects in Readify. It's a great tool. Being able to drop a message / question to entire team is very helpful even when team is in the same room. In one project we even had another room where client representatives were present. It enhances things a lot.
There is this as well https://github.com/kandanapp/kandan

Very nice!
Never looked for alternatives as my company has company-wide license, but sure will be in my head the next (first?) time I start something outside work with distributed team members.

Team chat certainly improved our communication at Tabshora, quick short bursts of text, distraction is at your own discretion not forced onto you. When you have a few minutes to spare you can check your messages, otherwise you're focused on your task without interruptions.
